p.s: Michel Barnier, the EU commissioner for the withdrawal negostationsnegotiations of the UK points out the consequences of Brexit and as well as the characteristics of a close relationship between the UK and the EU if the UK will leave the EU at the European American Chamber of Commerce in New York at the 10th July 2018 after having greeted the audience and having thanked for the opportunity to speak about this topic.
In his speech he makes clear that the Brexit is a lose-lose situation for the UK and the EU.

He makes it clear that the loss is greater for England, however, as the Brexit will make them a lot of financial services and a lot of particular manufacturing, logistic, agricultural and also food sectors.
Moreover it will cost England a lot to build up their own economy.
Countries will stop wanting to export with England as it becomes too expensive and thus England has no exports and their economy goes bust.
However, if they stayed in EU, they would have contacts with the EU single Marketmarket, wichwhich is open to third countries.
Also, in the EU the UK havehas free movement of capital to third countries (l. 18).
The EU has many economic advantages such as the most open market in the world (vgl. l. 28).
All in all you can say that they're are a lot of consequences for the UK if they leave the EU and the EU havehas a lot of advantages.
